name: Paracetamol
usage: Commonly used for pain relief (headache, muscle pain) and fever reduction.
dos_donts: Do: Take after food to avoid stomach upset. Don't: Exceed 4g (8 tablets) per day.
side_effects: Nausea, skin rash (rare), liver damage (if overdosed).
disclaimer: Consult a doctor if fever persists for more than 3 days.

name: Ibuprofen
usage: Anti-inflammatory drug used for pain, fever, and inflammation (e.g., arthritis).
dos_donts: Do: Take with food or milk. Don't: Take if you have stomach ulcers or asthma.
disclaimer: Avoid long-term use without medical advice.

name: Amoxicillin
usage: Antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections (e.g., ear, throat, chest infections).
dos_donts: Do: Complete the full course. Don't: Stop early even if you feel better.
disclaimer: Ineffective against viral infections like flu.

name: Cetirizine
usage: Antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms (hay fever, hives, itching).
dos_donts: Do: Take once a day. Don't: Drive if you feel drowsy.

name: Aspirin
usage: Pain reliever, fever reducer, and anti-inflammatory. Also used for heart health.
dos_donts: Do: Take with plenty of water. Don't: Give to children under 16 (Reye's syndrome risk).
disclaimer: Consult doctor if on blood thinners.

name: Metformin
usage: First-line medication for type 2 diabetes to control blood sugar.
dos_donts: Do: Take with meals. Don't: Skip meals while on medication.

name: Omeprazole
usage: Reduces stomach acid to treat heartburn, acid reflux, and ulcers.
dos_donts: Do: Take in the morning before breakfast. Don't: Use for more than 14 days without advice.
disclaimer: Seek help if swallowing becomes difficult.

name: Dolo 650
usage: Popular brand of Paracetamol for high fever and pain.
dos_donts: Do: Maintain gap of 4-6 hours between doses. Don't: Take with other paracetamol products.
disclaimer: Overdose can cause serious liver harm.

name: Azithromycin
usage: Macrolide antibiotic for respiratory, skin, and ear infections.
dos_donts: Do: Take 1 hour before or 2 hours after food. Don't: Take antacids simultaneously.

name: Pantoprazole
usage: Treats acid reflux, GERD, and stomach ulcers.
dos_donts: Do: Swallow whole; do not chew. Don't: Combine with alcohol regularly.
disclaimer: Long term use may affect bone density.

name: Vitamin C (Ascorbic Acid)
usage: Nutritional supplement for immunity and skin health.
dos_donts: Do: Store in cool, dry place. Don't: Take excessive amounts (kidney stone risk).
disclaimer: Supplements are not a substitute for a balanced diet.

name: Cough Syrup (Generic)
dos_donts: Do: Measure generic dose with cap. Don't: Drink directly from bottle.
disclaimer: Check label for 'drowsy' warning before driving.
